data.title: LOCOMAT: The LORIA COLLECTION of MATHEMATICAL TABLES
data.text:
LOCOMAT

The LORIA COLLECTION of MATHEMATICAL TABLES

DTL (Digital Tables Library)

--- Reconstructed tables ---

Content:

Introduction Trigonometric and logarithmic tables Tables of factors and primes Tables of multiplication, squares, cubes, etc. Farey sequences Sexagesimal tables Other tables General documents

Introduction

Aim of the project: making available a number of interesting and/or important historical tables, and facilitating the study of the original tables by historians of mathematics; in some cases, the entire original works have been reproduced; many of the original tables have already been digitized, and can now be easily checked.

Scope: currently, most of the tables in the collection are tables of trigonometric functions, tables of logarithms, or tables of factors.

Recomputations: most of the logarithmic and trigonometric tables were recomputed using the GNU MPFR floating point library.

Digital versions: links to digital versions of the original works have been added, when they are known; the following tables have been reconstructed before any of them was available online (at least to our knowledge): Pitiscus 1613, Napier 1616, Briggs 1617, Bürgi 1620, Gunter 1620, Briggs 1624, Vlacq 1628, Briggs 1633, Vlacq 1633, Brancker 1668, Mouton 1670, Chinese tables 1720, Shuli Jingyun 1723, the third part of Felkel 1776, Schenmark 1780, Prony's tables, Crelle 1836, Kulik 1851, Kulik 1863, Sang 1872, Glaisher 1879, Tissot 1880, SGA 1891, Mendizábal-Tamborrel 1891, Lehmer 1909, Andoyer 1911, Lehmer 1914, Andoyer 1922, Gifford 1931, Peters 1935, Kaván 1937, Merritt 1947, Neville 1950, Beeger 1951, Thompson 1952, and Gingerich 1965.

Errors: please notify us (roegel@loria.fr) of any error you might find in the reconstructions.

Contributions: a lot more work is needed and contributions are welcome.

Trigonometric and logarithmic tables

Regiomontanus: Tabule directionum profectionumque, 1490

Denis Roegel: A reconstruction of Regiomontanus's table of tangents (1490), 2021 (HAL record)

General information on the tables

Denis Roegel: Tables du cadastre: Complete project 2, ca. 1794, 2010

Denis Roegel: The great logarithmic and trigonometric tables of the French Cadastre: a preliminary investigation, 2010 (the version on HAL is older and typos have not yet been corrected, please get the newer version)

Auxiliary volumes:

Logarithms of numbers (each volume is 500 pages, except volume 1a which is a bit less, and volumes 1b and 1c which are 300 pages):

with exact calculations: volumes 1a, 2a, 3a, 4a, 5a, 6a, 7a, and 8a

with rounded interpolation: volumes 1b, 2b, 3b, 4b, 5b, 6b, 7b, and 8b

with hidden interpolation: volumes 1c, 2c, 3c, 4c, 5c, 6c, 7c, and 8c

Sines (each volume 400 pages):

with exact computation (volume 9a)

with rounded interpolation (volume 9b)

Logarithms of sines:

with exact computation: volumes 10a (550 p.), 11a (500 p.), 12a (500 p.), 13a (500 p.)

with rounded computation: volumes 10b (550 p.), 11b (500 p.), 12b (500 p.), 13b (500 p.)

Logarithms of tangents:

with exact computation: volumes 14a (500 p.), 15a (500 p.), 16a (500 p.), 17a (500 p.)

with rounded computation: volumes 14b (500 p.), 15b (500 p.), 16b (500 p.), 17b (500 p.)

Multiples of sines and cosines (each volume 500 pages):

with exact computation (volume 18a)

with rounded computation (volume 18b)

Volume 19 (introductory volume) will be redone in the future.

Abridged tables (each volume 200 pages):

with exact computation (volume 20a)

with rounded computation (volume 20b)
